file_content.text: My brother said you'd be persistent. But I was almost hoping we'd meet.
Pardon my forwardness to a--a daughter of the Emperor, but you should not risk yourself.
But, General--a chance to speak with the Barsen'thor herself.
But, General--a chance to speak with the Barsen'thor himself.
You were actually mentored by the First Son.
My mentor was Master Syo Bakarn, a Jedi Master and a force for good.
No, by Master Syo.
And your First Son had nothing to do with it.
You have to accept new loyalties as they come.
I have business with the First Son.
Where is he?
He left, and trusted this Guardian Hold to me.
You know why we're here, and how this must end.
Don't toy with me.
But I can learn from you.
Look at me. I was some nobody Republic corporal until the Emperor's voice called me.
I was reborn. Guardian Hold Four seemed like such a paltry gift in return.
If you truly wish to learn, the path of a Jedi remains open.
I could show you the light.
You want me to betray my new family?
Even if it means your death, Guardian Hold Four must return to Republic hands.
I'm sorry, I must stop you.
No! It belongs to us! If you try anything, I...
Oh, I know what would please my brother--seeing you humbled.
Scores of Republic soldiers--your colleagues--died for you to give this "gift."
You're despicable.
What are Republic grunts, compared to my brothers and sisters?
I don't know--honorable?
All these powers. I never knew I was so strong.
I could learn from you after all. For years, if I leave you alive.
There's so much I could still learn from you. Especially if I leave you alive.
